result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry W Riddle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Barry W Riddle is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Barry W Riddle was found guilty of Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Barry W Riddle in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Barry W Riddle in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Brown for insurance co. appears. Both parties recv'd and reviewed PSI.  Victim makes statement.  Court and DE have read the VIS.  Atty. Albrecht gives sentencing recommendation -  10 years (5 yrs. I.C./5 yrs. E.S); 339 days credit; $518 costs; restitution as stipulation w/25% of prison wages to restituiton; Absolute Sobriety; No possession of controlled substances; Seek & maintain f-t employment; no contact w/victims or T.S. or R.S.; AODA/treatment/counseling.  Eligible for CIP & SUBAT.  Atty. Frank gives recommendation - 5 years (2 yrs IC + 3 yrs ES) concurrent.  Court questions a review of the statute re: restitution being addressed prior to sentencing.  Atty Frank requests sentencing proceed and any restitution hearing be set later/cites 973.25(d) and 973.14(c).  Attorney from insurance company moves to counsel table w/Atty Albrecht.  Atty Frank makes argument re: restitution to a victim/insurance company.  State explains insurance stipulation as to restitution.  Insurance Co Rep. Atty Brown makes a statement/cites court of appeals decision as to insurance companies rec. restitution.  Atty Frank responds.  Atty Brown makes statement.  Court believes both parties are correct and ability to pay can be determined at a later date.  Court finds that the insurers should receive restitution.  Restitution to be paid first to J.M. and J.R. and then to be paid to the United Coop and then to the insurance companies.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  

15CF407 - Ct 2:
3 years prison (1 year IC and 2 years ES) concurrent to sentence in 15CF144

15CF144 - Ct 1:
7 years prison (4 years IC and 3 years ES) concurrent to sentence in 15CF407 but consecutive to any other sentence previously imposed

Conditions of extended supervision:
No contact w/any of the victims in either of the cases
No contact w/T.S. or R.S. unless approved by agent
Payment of restitution per stipulations filed
25% of prison wages to go to restitution
Absolute sobriety at all times
Maintain/obtain full-time employment/education per agent
AODA/Counseling/Treatment per agent
DNA sample to be provided
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 in each case
DE is eligible for CIP and SAP
339 days sentence credit to be applied to 15CF144
Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1

Defendant Barry W Riddle in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank.  Defendant Barry W Riddle in custody.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea to Ct. 2.  Cts. 1 & 3 be dismissed.  No contest plea entered to Ct. 2, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court orders PSI.  Dismiss Cts. 1 & 3.   Report to be done by March 11, 2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Barry W Riddle in court with attorney Mark W Frank.  Defendant Barry W Riddle in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Attorney Frank advises another pending case is set for Dec 21 with Br. 1, Judge Screnock.  Would request matters to track.  Advised rights to an attorney.   State request $10,000 signature bond.  No objection.  Time limits waived.  $10,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Return date scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 10:30 am.
